definition: the act of pulling, strain abnormally
details:
noun
- the act of pulling
= synonyms: pulling
- a sustained effort
= example: a sustained effort
- a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke)
= synonyms: puff, drag
- a device used for pulling something
= example: a device used for pulling something
- special advantage or influence
= example: special advantage or influence
= synonyms: clout
- the force used in pulling
= example: the force used in pulling
- a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments
= synonyms: twist, wrench
verb
- strain abnormally
= example: strain abnormally
= synonyms: overstretch
- take away
= example: take away
= synonyms: deprive, impoverish
- take sides with
= synonyms: root for
- remove, usually with some force or effort
= synonyms: extract, take out, draw out, pull out, pull up
- strip of feathers
= example: strip of feathers
= synonyms: pluck
- hit in the direction that the player is facing when carrying through the swing
= example: hit in the direction that the player is facing when carrying through the swing
- cause to move by pulling
= synonyms: draw, force
- direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes
= synonyms: pull in
- tear or be torn violently
= synonyms: rip, rive, rend
- apply force so as to cause motion towards the source of the motion
- rein in to keep from winning a race
= example: rein in to keep from winning a race
- operate when rowing a boat
= example: operate when rowing a boat
- bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
= synonyms: draw, take out, get out, pull out
- steer into a certain direction
= example: steer into a certain direction
- move into a certain direction
= example: move into a certain direction
- cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense
= example: cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense
= synonyms: draw
- perform an act, usually with a negative connotation
= synonyms: commit, perpetrate
